alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 8:10PM CDT until April 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Flooding continues on the Catoma Creek and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Thursday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
